intro: Diaphanoptera transhyrcana, commonly known as the Transhyrcan glasswing, is a species of planthopper belonging to the family Cixiidae. It is characterized by its delicate, translucent wings that give it its common name. The plant is native to Central Asia, where it thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. Its life cycle involves laying eggs on the stems of host plants, typically grasses and sedges. The plant's botanical significance lies in its ecological role within its native habitat and its unique morphological adaptations.
